trans-unit.source: Provides a type converter to convert <xref:System.TimeSpan> objects to and from other representations.
This converter can only convert a <xref:System.TimeSpan> object to and from a string.
For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
> [!NOTE] > You should never create an instance of a TimeSpanConverter.
Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> class.
For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TimeSpanConverter"></xref> class.
Gets a value indicating whether this converter can convert an object in the given source type to a <xref:System.TimeSpan> using the specified context.
This converter can only convert a <xref:System.TimeSpan> object to and from a string.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from.
This can be `null`, so always check.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
A <xref:System.Type> that represents the type you wish to convert from.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this converter can perform the conversion; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether this converter can convert an object to the given destination type using the context.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from.
This can be `null`, so always check.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
A <xref:System.Type> that represents the type you wish to convert to.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this converter can perform the conversion; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
destinationType is .
value is not a valid value for the target type.
Converts the given object to a <xref:System.TimeSpan>.
This converter can only convert a <xref:System.TimeSpan> object to and from a string.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from.
This can be `null`, so always check.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
An optional <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo>.
If not supplied, the current culture is assumed.
The <xref:System.Object> to convert.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the converted value.
The conversion cannot be performed.
value is not a valid value for the target type.
Converts the given object to another type.
This method most commonly converts types to and from string objects.
The default implementation will make a call to <xref:System.Object.ToString%2A> on the object if the object is valid and if the destination type is string.
If this method cannot convert to the destination type, it will throw a <xref:System.NotSupportedException>.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from.
This can be `null`, so always check.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
A formatter context.
The culture into which `value` will be converted.
The object to convert.
The type to convert the object to.
The converted object.
